conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict whether it flows into container D or E.
Points A, B, and C are at the top, and containers D and E are at the bottom.
There are barriers in the middle of the image that direct the flow of liquid.
The cyan liquid starts flowing from point A.
The cyan liquid flows downward but encounters a barrier on the right, directing it towards the center.
The orange liquid starts flowing from point B.
The orange liquid flows straight down between the barriers.
The pink liquid starts flowing from point C.
The pink liquid moves downward but is directed towards the center due to barriers.
All three liquids meet and combine into a single stream in the middle.
The combined stream hits a horizontal barrier, splitting the flow slightly, but the main direction remains downward.
The stream flows towards the center container, which is container D.
The liquid will flow into container D.
